content: Is there a "cheaper" way to rewrite under a binder than using simp_rw. E.g. something like conv?
conv can usually do it, although I can never remember how to actually jump inside the binder, so normally use conv in (...) { }
The ... is quite unwieldy, but I just noticed that conv { congr, skip, funext, } works as well
Jakob von Raumer has marked this topic as resolved.
Though it's a bit silly that the conv-funext doesn't let me choose the name of the binder
Remember you can put _ in the ... to make it less unwieldy

Jakob von Raumer said:

Though it's a bit silly that the conv-funext doesn't let me choose the name of the binder

This would be fairly easy feature to add if you really want it you should make an issue on github. It might be a nice thing for someone who wants to get into writing/modifying tactics to try, the only issue really is that funext for conv is in core.
Well someone who wants to get into writing tactics should do so in Lean 4.
